info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 31 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by recent excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Henderson County in western North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 200 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1056 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated occasional light to moderate rainfall from continuing showers affecting locations in central Henderson County that received heavy rainfall of 1 to 2 inches in the past 6 hours. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Flooding will most likely develop along Mud Creek near Erkwood Drive. Continued rises along Mud Creek may create flooding along East Caswell Street as well. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hendersonville, Flat Rock, Laurel Park, Valley Hill and Crab Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
